[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Management Processes module (MPM) defines requirements for 275 libraries managing 9.6 million items in the Georgia Public Library PINES network.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: MPM facilitates collections analysis, transaction tracking, and workflow optimization.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: MPM integrates with library systems, databases, and APIs for operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: MPM provides web and client-based interfaces for staff and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: MPM supports standard library hardware like scanners, printers, and servers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: MPM relies on APIs and relational databases for synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: MPM uses secure protocols like TLS and SFTP.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: MPM operates continuously with failover mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: MPM supports centralized or distributed library workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: MPM connects with vendor APIs and supports MARC21 standards for metadata exchange.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: MPM provides tools for server configuration, monitoring, user management, and reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: MPM is designed for library administrators, technical staff, and managers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: MPM relies on acquisitions and cataloging modules.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: MPM requires integration with cataloging systems and vendor APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: MARC21: Standard for encoding library metadata and bibliographic records.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with library systems for real-time data synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support API-based communication with third-party services (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall provide real-time server monitoring and status alerts.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable user account and permission management (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall perform automated data backups (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a user-friendly dashboard with accessibility support.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall include visual and text-based alerts for system events (REQ-USAB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process queries without significant delay under normal load conditions.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support several hundred concurrent users without performance degradation (REQ-PERF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store transaction records in a relational database with indexing.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall enforce ACID compliance for data integrity (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall use a relational database as the primary data store.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall generate HTML-compliant interfaces for cross-platform usability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with MARC21 for bibliographic metadata exchange.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log critical actions for auditing and dynamically scale based on demand.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit, integration, and user tests for MARC21 compliance and functionality.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, training, and troubleshooting materials.
[SEC] 5. References: MARC21 documentation, API integration guides, and Evergreen ILS documentation.
